t: A Prayer for Help, and Praise for Its Answer.
To*pn You, O Lord,*s I call; My*ln rock, do not be deaf to me, For*ln if You are silent to me, I*ln will become like those who go down to the pit.
Hear*ln the voice of my supplications when I cry to You for help, When*ln I lift up my hands toward Your holy sanctuary.
Do*ln not drag me away with the wicked And*ln with those who work iniquity, Who*ln speak peace with their neighbors, While*ln evil is in their hearts.
Requite*ln them according to their work and according to the evil of their practices; Requite*ln them according to the deeds of their hands; Repay*ln them their recompense.
Because*ln they do not regard the works of the Lord*s Nor*ln the deeds of His hands, He*ln will tear them down and not build them up.
Blessed*ln be the Lord,*s Because*ln He has heard the voice of my supplication.
The*ln Lord*s is my strength and my shield; My*ln heart trusts in Him, and I am helped; Therefore*ln my heart exults, And*ln with my song I shall thank Him.
The*ln Lord*s is their strength, And*ln He is a saving defense to His anointed.
Save*ln Your people and bless Your inheritance; Be*ln their shepherd also, and carry them forever.
